steps.description: The 'Get-GenericScimOAuthToken' function retrieves the accessToken. The function requires a 'ClientID' and 'ClientSecret'. Your application might use a different way of authenticating. Change this function accordingly.
The 'accessToken' will be retrieved within the '$dryRun' and will be added to the 'AuthorizationHeaders'.

The 'AuthorizationHeaders' containing the accessToken. The

Those three things (the 'Get-GenericScimOAuthToken', the '$accessToken' variable and the 'AuthorizationHeaders' might have to be changed according to the method of authentication your application is using)
The '$account' object contains all the properties that will be created within your application. These properties might vary in your application.
In the '$body' all the properties are added and converted to a json string. The look and feel of the body is standard for any SCIM API. The properties however might be different for your application.
